cover.deviceDescription:
Wireless AX6600 Tri band Router
Model: XT8
cover.labAddress: 7F .- 1, No. 286, Sec.1, Gaotiezhanqian W. Rd., Zhongli Dist., Taoyuan City

introduction.manufacturerAddress: No. 15, Lide Rd, Beitou District, Taipei City, 112

purposeScope.methodologyHtml: The assessment follows the guideline from the EN-40000 and OWASP as the methodology of the testing

productIdentification.productDescriptionHtml: The ASUS ZenWiFi AX (XT8) is a whole-home mesh Wi-Fi 6 system that delivers high-speed, reliable, and secure wireless internet to eliminate dead zones. It provides a total bandwidth of up to AX6600 Mbps, covering up to 5,500 square feet, and features the latest Wi-Fi 6 technology (OFDMA and MU-MIMO) for improved performance with multiple devices. The system includes easy setup and management via the ASUS Router app, AiProtection Pro for network security and parental controls, and AiMesh support for mixing and matching with other ASUS AiMesh-compatible router
productIdentification.keyFunctionsHtml:
• Whole-home coverage: The system is designed to provide seamless Wi-Fi coverage across large homes, with a typical two-pack covering up to 5,500 square feet.

  • Wi-Fi 6 (AX6600): It features the latest Wi-Fi 6 technology, which enables faster speeds and more efficient connections for multiple devices simultaneously through OFDMA and MU-MIMO.

  • Tri-band: The system uses a tri-band approach, with two 5 GHz bands and one 2.4 GHz band, to optimize performance.

  • AiMesh Support: You can easily integrate the ZenWiFi AX with other AiMesh-compatible routers to expand your network.

  • Security and parental controls: AiProtection Pro, powered by Trend Micro, provides lifetime free network security, including advanced parental controls.

  • Easy setup: The system is easy to set up and manage through the ASUS Router app.

  • Ports: Each unit includes additional ports, such as a 2.5 Gbps port and a USB 3.0 port for versatile connectivity.

  • Design: The system has an elegant, vertical design that houses a specially designed antenna and circuit board for optimal signal strength and performance
productIdentification.targetMarket: The target audience of this device is common user and enterprise user

manufacturerInformation.address: No. 15, Li-De Road, Beitou District, Taipei, Taiwan

productOverview.productDescriptionHtml:
Based on the user manual you provided, here is a detailed description of the product.

Physical Characteristics

The ASUS ZenWiFi AX (Model: XT8) is described as an "ultra-thin and stylish" tri-band router.

  • Hardware Components: The router package includes the ZenWiFi AX Wireless Router unit, a network (RJ-45) cable, and a power adapter. The unit is powered by a DC adapter with an output of +19V and 1.75A current. It features a Power LED, WAN LED, and LAN LEDs for status indication.

  • Interfaces: The rear panel of the router includes:

    • A DCIN port for the power adapter.

    • A Power button.

    • One 2.5G / 1G WAN port for connecting to a modem.

    • Three LAN ports (1-3) for wired PC connections.

    • A USB 3.0 port for connecting USB storage devices or printers.

    • A WPS button.

    • A Reset button.

  • Operating Environment: The device is specified to operate at temperatures between 0~40°C and in humidity of 50~90%.

Software Characteristics

  • Firmware: The router operates on system firmware that can be upgraded. The web GUI provides a "Firmware Upgrade" section where users can check for new versions or manually upload a firmware file.

  • Recovery: A "Firmware Restoration" utility is provided for Windows to restore the firmware if an upgrade fails. This process requires putting the router into a special "rescue mode" by holding the Reset button while plugging in the power.

  • Software Licensing: The product includes third-party software licensed under the GNU General Public License (GPL) Version 2.

Network Connectivity

  • Wireless Capabilities: The product is a Wireless AX6600 Tri band Router. It supports tri-band technology, simultaneously broadcasting on 2.4GHz, 5GHz-1, and 5GHz-2 wireless bands. It is designed to be compatible with IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac wireless devices.

  • WAN Connectivity: The router can connect to the internet via its 2.5G / 1G WAN port. It supports multiple WAN connection types, including Dynamic IP (DHCP), PPPoE, PPTP, L2TP, and Static IP. It also supports using a 3G/4G USB modem as an internet source.

  • LAN Connectivity: The router provides three LAN ports for wired connections, supporting 10Base-T/100Base-TX/1000Base-TX Ethernet. It functions as a DHCP server to automatically assign IP addresses to network clients.

  • Network Protocols:

    • Addressing: Supports both IPv4 and IPv6 protocols.

    • Services: It supports NAT, UPnP, Dynamic DNS (DDNS), and Network Time Protocol (NTP) for system time synchronization.

    • VPN: The router includes NAT Passthrough for PPTP, L2TP, and IPsec VPN connections.

    • Routing: The router supports configuring static routes.

    • Specialized: It includes configuration options for IPTV services.

  • Wireless Security:

    • Authentication: Supports Open System, Shared Key, WPA/WPA2/WPA Auto-Personal, and WPA/WPA2/WPA Auto-Enterprise, and Radius with 802.1x.

    • Encryption: Supports WEP (64-bit/128-bit), TKIP, and AES encryption methods.

    • Access Control: Features a Wireless MAC Filter that can be set to "Accept" or "Reject" modes.

    • Setup: Supports Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) via a physical button and PIN code method.

User Interface

Users interact with the product through several interfaces:

  • Web Graphical User Interface (GUI): The primary interface is an "intuitive web graphical user interface". It is accessed by navigating to http://router.asus.com in a web browser. The default login credentials are "admin" for both username and password. The GUI is used to configure all general and advanced settings.

  • Setup Wizard: On first login, a Quick Internet Setup (QIS) wizard launches automatically to guide the user through the initial internet connection setup.

  • Mobile App: The router supports the ASUS AiCloud 2.0 app, available from Google Play Store or Apple Store, which allows users to access files and services.

  • Command Line & Remote Access: The router's web GUI provides options to enable or disable Telnet and SSH access.

  • Physical Controls: Users interact with the hardware via a Power button, a Reset button (for factory defaults or rescue mode), and a WPS button (for easy wireless setup).

  • PC Utilities: ASUS provides utilities for Windows, including "Device Discovery" (to find the router's IP), "Firmware Restoration," and "ASUS EZ Printer Sharing".

Data Processing

The router processes, stores, and transmits several types of data:

  • Network Packet Data: Its core function is processing and routing all network traffic (data packets) between the internet (WAN) and the local wired (LAN) and wireless (Wi-Fi) devices. It can prioritize this data using Quality of Service (QoS) rules.

  • User File Data: When a USB storage device is connected, the router can process, store, and transmit user files. It supports:

    • File Sharing: Serving files via Samba (Network Place), FTP (AiDisk, Servers Center), and DLNA (Media Server).

    • Cloud Sync: Syncing files between the USB storage and ASUS WebStorage via AiCloud Sync.

    • P2P Downloads: The Download Master utility processes and stores BitTorrent and NZB files directly onto the attached USB drive.

  • Security and Log Data:

    • Threat Data: The AiProtection feature processes network traffic to detect malware, spyware, and network exploits.

    • Filter Data: The Firewall and Parental Controls process network requests to filter data based on URLs, keywords, and service types.

    • System Logs: The router generates and stores logs of network activities, including DHCP leases, wireless client connections, port forwarding, and general system events. This log data is cleared upon reboot.

  • Printer Data: The router processes and transmits print job data from network clients to a USB-connected printer using the LPR protocol or the ASUS EZ Printer Sharing utility.

  • Configuration Data: The router stores all user-configured settings, such as SSIDs, passwords, firewall rules, and IP settings. These settings can be saved to or restored from a local file via the web GUI.
productOverview.productArchitectureHtml:
Key Components

Hardware Components:

  • ZenWiFi AX (XT8) Router: The main processing unit containing the CPU, memory, and wireless radios.

  • Tri-Band Wireless Radios: Three separate radios operating on the 2.4GHz, 5GHz-1, and 5GHz-2 bands.

  • Network Ports: Physical interfaces for wired connections, including one 2.5G / 1G WAN port and three LAN ports.

  • USB 3.0 Port: A high-speed port for connecting external devices.

  • Power Adapter: An external component supplying DC power (+19V, 1.75A) to the router.

Software Components:

  • Web GUI: An intuitive web-based graphical user interface for all router configuration.

  • Quick Internet Setup (QIS): A setup wizard that automatically launches on first login to guide users.

  • DHCP Server: A service that automatically assigns IP addresses to clients on the local network.

  • Firewall: A software module for network security, which includes a URL Filter, Keyword Filter, and Network Services Filter.

  • AiProtection: A major security suite that includes "Network Protection" (Malicious Sites Blocking, Two-Way IPS) and "Parental Controls" (Web & Apps Filters, Time Scheduling).

  • Traffic Manager (QoS): A component for managing and prioritizing network bandwidth.

  • USB Application Module: A software layer that manages services for the USB port, including:

    • AiDisk / Servers Center: Provides FTP, Samba, and DLNA Media Server capabilities for file sharing from a USB drive.

    • Network Printer Server: Allows sharing a USB printer over the network using LPR or the ASUS EZ Printer utility.

    • Download Master: A utility to download BitTorrent and NZB files directly to USB storage.

    • 3G/4G Modem Support: A service to enable internet access via a 3G/4G USB modem.

  • AiCloud 2.0: A software component that enables personal cloud services, including "Cloud Disk" (remote file access), "Smart Access," and "AiCloud Sync" (syncing with ASUS WebStorage).

  • DDNS Client: A service that updates a remote DDNS provider with the router's current public IP address.

Component Interactions

  • The Web GUI is the primary control interface for all other software components; user changes in the GUI configure the Firewall, DHCP Server, AiProtection, and all other services.

  • AiProtection and the Firewall components interact with the router's core packet processing to inspect traffic, block requests to malicious domains, and enforce parental control rules.

  • The USB Application Module interacts directly with the physical USB 3.0 Port to detect a connected device (storage, printer, or modem) and provide data to its sub-services (like AiDisk, Download Master, or the Printer Server).

  • The Download Master component processes download tasks and writes the resulting file data to the USB-connected storage device.

  • The AiCloud 2.0 component reads from and writes to the USB-connected storage to serve files remotely ("Cloud Disk") and sync files with the external ASUS WebStorage service ("AiCloud Sync").

  • The DDNS Client communicates with the remote ASUS DDNS service (or other providers) to register the router's domain name.

External Interfaces

  • Physical Interfaces:

    • 1x 2.5G / 1G WAN port (RJ-45) for connecting to a modem.

    • 3x LAN ports (RJ-45) for connecting to local network devices like PCs.

    • 1x USB 3.0 port for connecting storage devices, printers, or 3G/4G modems.

  • Wireless Interfaces:

    • 2.4GHz Wi-Fi (IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac compatible).

    • 5GHz-1 Wi-Fi (IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac compatible).

    • 5GHz-2 Wi-Fi (IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac compatible).

  • Software & Management Interfaces:

    • Web GUI: Accessible via a web browser (HTTP/HTTPS) at http://router.asus.com.

    • Mobile App: The ASUS AiCloud 2.0 app for smart devices.

    • CLI: Telnet and SSH services can be enabled for command-line access.

    • File Protocols: FTP, Samba (Network Place), and DLNA are exposed for file sharing.

    • Printer Protocol: LPR (Line Printer Remote) protocol is supported for network printing.

Remote Data Processing Solutions (RDPS)

  • AiProtection Cloud Database: The "Malicious Sites Blocking" feature relies on a remote cloud database to get an always-up-to-date list of malicious websites to block.

  • ASUS DDNS Service: A remote service provided by ASUS that maps a user-chosen host name (e.g., myrouter.asuscomm.com) to the router's dynamic WAN IP address.

  • ASUS WebStorage: An external cloud storage service. The "AiCloud Sync" component processes and syncs files from the router's attached USB drive to the user's ASUS WebStorage account.

  • NTP Server: The router contacts an external Network Time Protocol (NTP) server to synchronize its system clock.

  • Firmware Update Server: The router's firmware upgrade utility can "Check" for new firmware versions, implying communication with a remote ASUS server to verify and download updates.

Evidence Reference

Unavailable. The provided user manual does not contain any architectural diagrams, data flow diagrams, or repository references.

primaryStandard.description: Cybersecurity requirements for products with digital elements - Part 1-2: Principles for cyber resilience

terminologyEntries.definition: A product or system that contains digital components or software functions which can process, transmit, or store data.
The ability to protect devices, networks, and services from digital attacks that compromise confidentiality, integrity, or availability.
A weakness in design, implementation, or operation that an attacker could exploit to compromise the product.
The combination of the likelihood of a cybersecurity event occurring and the severity of its impact.
Remote Digital Product Support services used to monitor, configure, or update the product post-deployment.
Software Bill of Materials describing all software components within the product.
Installed Product Release and Field Updates covering deployed versions and corrective maintenance.

documentConvention.evidenceNotationHtml:
Throughout this document, evidence is referenced in green using the following notation:

[EVD-XXX] - Evidence document reference

[DOC-XXX] - Supporting documentation reference

[TEST-XXX] - Test report reference

[ARCH-XXX] - Architecture documentation reference

All evidence documents are listed in Appendix A: Evidence Register.
documentConvention.requirementNotationHtml:
Requirements from EN 40000-1-2-2025 are presented in blue and italicized to distinguish them from descriptive text.

Example:

Requirement [Clause X.X.X]:

"The product shall..."
documentConvention.assessmentVerdictsHtml:
Each requirement is assessed using the following verdicts:

  • PASS - Requirement is fully satisfied with adequate evidence

  • FAIL - Requirement is not satisfied

  • PARTIAL - Requirement is partially satisfied (details provided)

  • N/A - Requirement is not applicable to this product

riskManagement.generalApproachHtml:
Risk Management Framework Applied:

[Describe the overall risk management approach used. Use own words or use this template:]

The [Company Name] has established a systematic risk management process that is applied throughout the product lifecycle. This process is based on the requirements of Clause 6 of EN 40000-1-2-2025 and includes the following elements:

  1. Product Context Establishment

    Defining the scope, intended use, operational environment, and users

  2. Risk Acceptance Criteria

    Establishing clear criteria for when risks are acceptable

  3. Risk Assessment - Identifying assets, threats, and estimating risks

  4. Risk Treatment - Applying avoidance, mitigation, acceptance, or transfer strategies

  5. Risk Communication - Ensuring stakeholders are informed of relevant risks

  6. Risk Monitoring and Review - Continuously monitoring and updating risk information

Risk Management Process Diagram:

[Include or reference a process flow diagram]

Evidence Reference:

[EVD-RM-001] Risk Management Plan

Risk Management Methodology:

The following methodology is used for risk assessment and treatment:

[Describe the specific methodology]

"The [Company Name] uses a qualitative risk matrix approach based on..." or "The manufacturer uses CVSS scoring for vulnerability assessment..." or "The manufacturer applies threat modeling using STRIDE methodology..."

Test

productContext.foreseeableUseHtml:
[Template] Identify the people that can influence risk posture.

The following stakeholder groups interact with Asus ZenWifi AX:

  1. Primary operators: [e.g., clinical staff, field engineers] with privileges limited to [controls].

  2. Privileged maintainers: [e.g., manufacturer DevSecOps] responsible for secure updates and diagnostics.

  3. External parties: [Supply-chain partners, managed service providers, regulators] receiving curated data.

[Reference stakeholder communication plans or SLAs backing this section.]
